newsitem.title: USA: US's Kantor expects 'positive' China-US trade meet.
newsitem.headline: US's Kantor expects 'positive' China-US trade meet.

text.p: U.S. Commerce Secretary Mickey Kantor said he expected two days of Sino-U.S. trade discussions to be "positive and helpful."
Chinese Trade Minister Wu Yi and Kantor met briefly in private Thursday before formally opening the meetings of the U.S.-China Joint Commission on Commerce and Trade.
While software and related issues were expected to dominate the commission's time, Wu and Kantor were scheduled to meet Friday to discuss a variety of trade frictions.
Wu told Chinese reporters that she had a cordial meeting with White House economic advisor Laura Tyson.
As part of the U.S.-China talks, officials were expected to announce details of recently-won software contracts between U.S. firms and three Chinese government agencies.

"Our Chinese colleagues have carried on these (commission) meetings in a positive and helpful vein," Kantor told reporters before the meeting convened. "I assume this meeting will be in the same light."
China and the United States agreed on intellectual property rights protection in June, following years of U.S. complaints of copyright and trademark violations.
China is the fifth leading U.S. trade partner.
